title: The Diagnostic Value of Urine Versus Bladder Washing in Patients with Bladder Cancer
abstract: No AccessJournal of Urology1 Sep 1981The Diagnostic Value of Urine Versus Bladder Washing in Patients with Bladder Cancer William M. Murphy, William N. Crabtree, Alina F. Jukkola, and Mark S. Soloway William M. MurphyWilliam M. Murphy More articles by this author , William N. CrabtreeWilliam N. Crabtree More articles by this author , Alina F. JukkolaAlina F. Soloway More articles by this author View All Author Informationhttps://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-5347(17)54505-XAboutPDF ToolsAdd to favoritesDownload CitationsTrack CitationsPermissionsReprints ShareFacebookLinked InTwitterEmail In a prospective, critical appraisal of simultaneously collected cystoscopic urine and bladder washing for the evaluation of patients with bladder cancer little consistent difference in cellular yield or preservation could be documented between the 2 techniques. Diagnostic cells usually occurred in both types of specimens but in 20 to 30 per cent of the cases they could be identified only in cystoscopic urine. Over-all, 13.1 per cent of the cancers would have been missed had cystoscopic urine not been examined cytologically. Although bladder washing alone has a greater diagnostic yield than cystoscopic urine alone urine remains a valuable source of diagnostic information and should be evaluated, even when simultaneously collected bladder washings are available. © 1981 by The American Urological Association Education and Research, Inc.FiguresReferencesRelatedDetailsCited byKusuda L, Kimmel M, Fair W and Melamed M (2018) Hypocellular Bladder Wash Specimens and their Clinical SignificanceJournal of Urology, VOL. 150, NO. 4, (1123-1125), Online publication date: 1-Oct-1993.Miller D, Fitkin D, Kropp K and Selman S (2018) A New Technique for Bladder WashingJournal of Urology, VOL. 147, NO. 1, (189-191), Online publication date: 1-Jan-1992.Yalla S (2018) Editorial CommentJournal of Urology, VOL. 133, NO. 6, (1035-1035), Online publication date: 1-Jun-1985.Locke J, Hill D and Walzer Y (2018) Incidence of Squamous Cell Carcinoma in Patients With Long-term Catheter DrainageJournal of Urology, VOL. 133, NO. 6, (1034-1035), Online publication date: 1-Jun-1985.Skinner D (2018) Editorial CommentsJournal of Urology, VOL. 130, NO. 1, (63-63), Online publication date: 1-Jul-1983.Hopkins S, Ford K and Soloway M (2018) Invasive Bladder Cancer: Support for ScreeningJournal of Urology, VOL. 130, NO. 1, (61-63), Online publication date: 1-Jul-1983.
